(a) I judge, whether in a law-court or privately: sometimes with cognate nouns emphasizing the notion of the verb, (b) I decide, I think (it) good.

7.brief: I come down, arrive at, reach
7.long: (a) I come down, either from high land to lower (or actually to the sea-coast), or from the high seas to the coast; hence met: I arrive at, reach (my destination), (b) of property: I come down (descend) by inheritance to an heir.

7.long: I bring a charge against, accuse.

29.brief: an untranslatable word that makes a statement contingent
